page.title: 08FORESTRY IN COWAL.
page.content: The Forestry Commission's office for this area is in Kilmun on the edge of the A880 to Ardentinny.In{Cowal}the Forestry Commission own {17600 {hectares }and{16800 hectares }is full of trees.The Forestry Commission's main trees are {SITKA SPRUCE,PINE, {LARCH}and {DOUGLAS FIR. A young tree can grow as much as 2 to 3 feet in a year. The workers have to go up the hill to spray the bracken so that it won't smother the trees when the bracken dies in the winter. The oldest trees have been left for up to 60 or 70 years. The Forestry Commission cut down trees at about 45 years old. There are a few types of machines used. One of the machines is the {Harvester} which can cut down and cut the branches off{100}trees in 1 hour.
